bwwExcerpt: "Garfield shows us a young man who is troubled, angered and deeply affected by the hypocritical rhetoric of his father. But he does not show us a young man who has gone out and failed. His visage is infused with articulate, attractive innocence; yet when you've been in jail, you have scars, scars that Biff needs, because it finally drives him to action." Charles McNulty, Los Angeles Times: "Garfield plunges to the sea-floor bottom of this fractured father-son relationship and reveals unspeakable
